job_description: software engineering job for the role Software Developer Intern 2026 -  Cambridge

• Build Systems: Understanding of how code moves from a developer’s machine to production, including experience with containerization (Docker/Kubernetes).
• Life at Salesforce Our Locations Our Locations North America Europe, Middle East, and Africa Asia Pacific Latin America Our Teams Our Teams Sales Technology & Product Customer Success Corporate Roles AI Research University University Overview Interns New Grads Advanced Degrees Associate Program Manager Talent Programs Talent Programs Overview Future Pathways India Return to Work Military Fellows Our Story Newsroom Blog Careers Trust Salesforce.
• Org Sustainability Investors Give us your Feedback Strong background in Computer Science or a related engineering disciplineMust be located in North AmericaAcademic, professional or internship experience working in a professional engineering or cybersecurity environmentFluency in software coding and code reviews University Overview Interns New Grads Advanced Degrees Associate Program Manager Knowledge of application and cloud securityKnowledge of securing AI systemsKnowledge with CI/CD pipelinesKnowledge of Linux General InformationRequired CookiesFunctional CookiesAdvertising Cookies.
• Secure SDLC Integration: Collaborate with engineering teams to integrate security checkpoints into the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) without slowing down the pace of innovation.
• Pipeline & Build Security: Harden CI/CD pipelines (e.
• , Jenkins, GitHub Actions) to prevent unauthorized code injection and ensure the integrity of build artifacts.
• Software Supply Chain Defense: Monitor and secure the software supply chain by verifying third-party dependencies, managing Software Bill of Materials (SBOMs), and implementing provenance checks.
• Cloud Infrastructure Security: Assist in securing cloud-native environments (AWS/GCP/Azure), focusing on resource configuration and secure deployment patterns.

• Your role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and implement software applications that meet the needs of our customers.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
• In this role, you will play a key part in defining software requirements, designing embedded solutions, and verifying system performance, ensuring our maintenance systems meet the evolving needs of modern aircraft.
• The ideal candidate will bring hands‑on experience with system‑level testing, REST APIs, structured data formats, and embedded or IoT platforms to ensure the reliability, performance, and compliance of technologies deployed across mission‑critical environments worldwide.
• You’ll bridge engineering and IT to ensure complex aerospace development ecosystems perform at scale, meet rigorous standards, and align with regulatory and export‑controlled requirements.
• This position is ideal for engineers experienced in modern software development methodologies, debugging, and performance optimization, who thrive in highly technical, cross‑functional environments.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements You will report directly to our Senior Engineering Manager and you will work out of our Phoenix, AZ location on a Hybrid work schedule.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
